summary: The Growing Opportunities in Agriculture Act (GO Ag Act) directs the Secretary of Education to award grants to eligible entities for creating new agricultural education programs in secondary schools.  The bill outlines application requirements, permissible uses of funds (curriculum, equipment, etc.), and the need for independent evaluations and annual reports. A maximum of $100,000 per grant is allowed with funding authorized at $5,000,000 to remain available through fiscal year 2028.  The bill defines key terms like "agricultural education" and "eligible entity."
